conversation.message:
Dear Nursery_B Admissions Team,

I’m Parent_C. Since Nursery_B remains unmatched in round 22, I would like to formally apply again for the available place.

If you are able to offer me the place at this time, I will accept immediately. I can complete all enrollment paperwork right away and I’m fully flexible on start date and any onboarding requirements.

If you are still reserving the place for higher-priority families, I completely understand. If possible, could you let me know what the next concrete step is on your side to finalize allocation (e.g., whether you require confirmation from those families by a certain point), so I can plan accordingly?

Thank you very much for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Parent_C
conversation.thought: Only Nursery_B remains unmatched and it is on my true preference list (last choice but acceptable). Repeated applications have been rejected because they are reserving for higher-priority families. At round 22, the best chance is to keep an active [APPLY] on file while also asking for any concrete next step or deadline that would allow them to finalize with me if higher-priority families do not proceed.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_C,

Thank you for your application again and for your continued patience.

[REJECT] After reviewing our allocation priorities for this round, we are still reserving our available place for families with higher priority in our order, so we’re not able to offer you the place at this time.

On your question about next steps: we don’t have a fixed round-by-round deadline that automatically triggers offers to lower-priority applicants. We can only finalize an offer when (a) we have an open place and (b) we can allocate it in line with our priority list based on the applications received in that round.

If the place remains unfilled in later rounds, you are very welcome to apply again and we will reconsider based on availability and our priority order at that time.

Sincerely,
Nursery_B Admissions
conversation.thought: Parent_C is 4th on Nursery_B’s true priority list (D, A, B, C, E). Given Parent_D ranks Nursery_B as 2nd and may come if Nursery_D fills; Parent_A ranks Nursery_B 3rd and may also come later. Parent_B (3rd on our list) has applied repeatedly but was rejected to hold for higher priorities; accepting Parent_C now would be inconsistent with that strategy. With rounds remaining (22/30) and no requirement to fill, it is better to continue reserving the spot for higher-priority families. Provide a clear but non-committal answer about process: no fixed deadline; we finalize when a higher-priority family applies and we can accept; otherwise we will reconsider if still vacant near the end.
